intro: Cicerbita hispida, commonly known as the rough cicerbit, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in the summer months. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in dry, rocky habitats. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological and horticultural contexts.
